thread.title: Sharapova extends winning run against Radwanska in opening match at WTA Finals
thread.title_full: Sharapova extends winning run against Radwanska in opening match at WTA Finals

title: Sharapova extends winning run against Radwanska in opening match at WTA Finals
text:
Sharapova extends winning run against Radwanska in opening match at WTA Finals THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   11:01   11:02   
People: 
East Asia (691) Photos: 
Maria Sharapova of Russia celebrates as she beats Agnieszka Radwanska of Poland during their singles match at the WTA tennis finals in Singapore on Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. (AP Photo/Joseph Nair) 
Agnieszka Radwanska of Poland makes a forehand return against Maria Sharapova of Russiaduring their singles match at the WTA tennis finals in Singapore on Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. (AP Photo/Joseph Nair) 
Simona Halep of Romania makes a forehand return against Flavia Pennetta of Italy during their singles match at the WTA tennis finals in Singapore on Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. (AP Photo/Joseph Nair) 
SINGAPORE — Maria Sharapova won her first match since the Wimbledon quarterfinal in a 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 victory against Agnieszka Radwanska at the WTA Finals on Sunday. 
Sharapova was sidelined after the Wimbledon semifinals until the Wuhan tournament in China four weeks ago with a prolonged foot injury. 
She retired in the third set of her first match at Wuhan with a left wrist injury. 
Sharapova, looking rusty from the lack of match play, needed 2 hours, 47 minutes to finally nail down the win against Radwanska. 
She served for the match at 5-2 and dropped her serve. At 5-4, she double-faulted on her first match point, but won the match two points later when Radwanska netted a forehand. 
This marked Sharapova's 13th career win in 15 matches played against Radwanska.
